verses.verse: My son, <S%H1121><s%> keep <S%H8104><s%> my words, <S%H561><s%> and lay up <S%H6845><s%> my commandments <S%H4687><s%> with <S%H854><s%> thee.
Keep <S%H8104><s%> my commandments, <S%H4687><s%> and live; <S%H2421><s%> and my law <S%H8451><s%> as the apple <S%H380><s%> of thine eye. <S%H5869><s%>
Bind <S%H7194><s%> them upon <S%H5921><s%> thy fingers, <S%H676><s%> write <S%H3789><s%> them upon <S%H5921><s%> the table <S%H3871><s%> of thine heart. <S%H3820><s%>
Say <S%H559><s%> unto wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> Thou <S%H859><s%> art my sister; <S%H269><s%> and call <S%H7121><s%> understanding <S%H998><s%> thy kinswoman: <S%H4129><s%>

That they may keep <S%H8104><s%> thee from the strange <S%H2114><s%> woman, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H802><s%> from the stranger <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5237><s%> which flattereth <S%H2505><s%> with her words. <S%H561><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> at the window <S%H2474><s%> of my house <S%H1004><s%> I looked <S%H8259><s%> through <S%H1157><s%> my casement, <S%H822><s%>
And beheld <S%H7200><s%> among the simple ones, <S%H6612><s%> I discerned <S%H995><s%> among the youths, <S%H1121><s%> a young man <S%H5288><s%> void <S%H2638><s%> of understanding, <S%H3820><s%>
Passing <S%H5674><s%> through the street <S%H7784><s%> near <S%H681><s%> her corner; <S%H6438><s%> and he went <S%H6805><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> to her house, <S%H1004><s%>
In the twilight, <S%H5399><s%> in the evening, <S%H6153><s%> <S%H3117><s%> in the black <S%H380><s%> and dark <S%H653><s%> night: <S%H3915><s%>
And, behold, <S%H2009><s%> there met <S%H7125><s%> him a woman <S%H802><s%> with the attire <S%H7897><s%> of a harlot, <S%H2181><s%> and subtle <S%H5341><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>
(She <S%H1931><s%> is loud <S%H1993><s%> and stubborn; <S%H5637><s%> her feet <S%H7272><s%> abide <S%H7931><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> in her house: <S%H1004><s%>
Now <S%H6471><s%> is she without, <S%H2351><s%> now <S%H6471><s%> in the streets, <S%H7339><s%> and lieth in wait <S%H693><s%> at <S%H681><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> corner.) <S%H6438><s%>
So she caught <S%H2388><s%> him, and kissed <S%H5401><s%> him, and with an impudent <S%H5810><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him,
I have peace offerings <S%H2077><s%> <S%H8002><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> me; this day <S%H3117><s%> have I paid <S%H7999><s%> my vows. <S%H5088><s%>
Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> came I forth <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> thee, diligently to seek <S%H7836><s%> thy face, <S%H6440><s%> and I have found <S%H4672><s%> thee.
I have decked <S%H7234><s%> my bed <S%H6210><s%> with coverings of tapestry, <S%H4765><s%> with carved <S%H2405><s%> works, with fine linen <S%H330><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
I have perfumed <S%H5130><s%> my bed <S%H4904><s%> with myrrh, <S%H4753><s%> aloes, <S%H174><s%> and cinnamon. <S%H7076><s%>
Come, <S%H1980><s%> let us take our fill <S%H7301><s%> of love <S%H1730><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the morning: <S%H1242><s%> let us solace ourselves <S%H5965><s%> with loves. <S%H159><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> the goodman <S%H376><s%> is not <S%H369><s%> at home, <S%H1004><s%> he is gone <S%H1980><s%> a long <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7350><s%> journey: <S%H1870><s%>
He hath taken <S%H3947><s%> a bag <S%H6872><s%> of money <S%H3701><s%> with <S%H3027><s%> him, and will come <S%H935><s%> home <S%H1004><s%> at the day <S%H3117><s%> appointed. <S%H3677><s%>
With her much <S%H7230><s%> fair speech <S%H3948><s%> she caused him to yield, <S%H5186><s%> with the flattering <S%H2506><s%> of her lips <S%H8193><s%> she forced <S%H5080><s%> him.

He goeth <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> her straightway, <S%H6597><s%> as an ox <S%H7794><s%> goeth <S%H935><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the slaughter, <S%H2874><s%> or as a fool <S%H191><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the correction <S%H4148><s%> of the stocks; <S%H5914><s%>

Till <S%H5704><s%> a dart <S%H2671><s%> strike through <S%H6398><s%> his liver; <S%H3516><s%> as a bird <S%H6833><s%> hasteth <S%H4116><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the snare, <S%H6341><s%> and knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> is for his life. <S%H5315><s%>
Hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto me now <S%H6258><s%> therefore, O ye children, <S%H1121><s%> and attend <S%H7181><s%> to the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
Let not <S%H408><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> decline <S%H7847><s%> to <S%H413><s%> her ways, <S%H1870><s%> go not astray <S%H8582><s%> <S%H408><s%> in her paths. <S%H5410><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> she hath cast down <S%H5307><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> wounded: <S%H2491><s%> yea, many <S%H3605><s%> strong <S%H6099><s%> men have been slain <S%H2026><s%> by her.
Her house <S%H1004><s%> is the way <S%H1870><s%> to hell, <S%H7585><s%> going down <S%H3381><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the chambers <S%H2315><s%> of death. <S%H4194><s%>
